-1.title: What Does Fandom Mean to You?
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Comparisons Between the Two Major Comics Publishers
1.plot: The panel discusses comparisons between the two major comics publishers and their distinctive storytelling styles. Plus an interview with Dick Ayers and Cool Toys segment on Captain America's Shield and Thor's Hammer.

2.title: Best Books We're Not Reading
2.plot: The panel discusses the best books they're not reading, entertaining books from publishers other than Marvel and DC. Plus, an interview with Ron Wilson (pt. 1), and Cool Toys segment with Anakin Skywalker Episode III Force FX light saber.

3.title: The Business of Comics and Meeting Deadlines
3.plot: The panel discusses the business of comics and meeting deadlines, creator's rights. Plus an interview with Tom Raney by correspondent George LaVigne and Cool Toys segment on Green Lantern Power Battery.

4.title: Casting Call for the Watchmen Movie
4.plot: The panel does a "casting call" for the Watchmen movie. Plus an interview with Keith Champagne by correspondent George LaVigne and Cool Toys segment on die cast Speed Racer Mach V.

5.title: The Nature of the Struggle of Good Vs. Evil
5.plot: The panel discusses the nature of the struggle of good vs. evil. Plus an interview with Ron Wilson (pt. 2) and Cool Toys segment on MR Starfleet phaser, communicator and tricorder.

6.title: The Search for the Ultimate Comic Book
6.plot: The panel discusses the search for the ultimate comic book; Daredevil #7, the nature of comic book heroism. Plus an interview with Mike Golden and a Cool Toys segment on die cast Racer X Shooting Star.

7.title: Impact of Novelists Writing Comics
7.plot: The panel discusses the impact of novelists writing comics. Plus, an interview with Jamal Igle and Cool Toys segment on Marvel Legends X-Men.

8.title: What Is Fun About Comic Books?
8.plot: The panel discusses what's fun about comic books and the best comics to movie adaptations. Plus, an interview with Mark Romanowski by correspondent George LaVigne and a Cool Toys segment on Robosapien.

9.title: Panelists' Recommendations of and Cool Observations in Current Comics
9.plot: Panelists make recommendations of and cool observations in current comics, as well as discuss superhero costumes colored red, green, yellow and black. Plus an interview with Tom Price, Hero Clix guru.

10.title: Panelist Weblogs Wide Reach and Influence
10.plot: Panelists discuss weblogs' wide reach and influence, as well as great comics miniseries. Plus coverage of Free Comic Book Day.

11.title: Greatest Battle Cries and Exclamations, Favorite Artists
11.plot: The panel discusses comics' greatest battle cries and exclamations, as well as their favorite artists. Plus an interview with Eric Battle (pt. 1) and Cool Toys segment on Resaurus Mach 5 playset.

12.title: Politics and Political Portrayals and Their Relationship to American Comics
12.plot: The panel discusses politics and political portrayals and their relationship to American comics. Plus, a Cool Toys segment on Lost in Space Robots.

13.title: Comics Company Crossovers
13.plot: The panel discusses comics company crossovers, plus a Cool Toys segment on DC Direct Justice League.

1.title: Multi-Comics Crossovers, Are Weekly Comics Here to Stay?
1.plot: The panel discusses multi-comics crossovers, and are weekly comics here to stay? Plus, an interview with Frank Cho and a Cool Toys segment on DC Universe action figures. BPD Newsbrief w/Andrea McPherson and Ulysses E. Campbell.

2.title: 2007 in Comics; Highlights and Disappointments
2.plot: The panel discusses 2007 in comics, highlights and disappointments. Plus an interview with Matt Wagner, Cool Toys segment on classic TV scale replicas, and BPD Newsbrief with Andrea McPherson and Ulysses E. Campbell.

3.title: The Wonderful and Diverse World of Japanese Animation a/K/A Anime
3.plot: The panel discusses the wonderful and diverse world of Japanese animation aka anime, plus a Ulie Rants segment on the JLA/Avengers crossover and BPD Newsbrief w/Andrea McPherson.

4.title: Evaluation of Wizard Magazine's Top 200 Comics Characters, What Makes a Great Story Great?
4.plot: The panel discusses Wizard Magazine's Top 200 comics characters, and what makes a great story great? Plus an interview with Bernie Wrightson, BPD Newsbrief w/Andrea McPherson, and Cool Toys segment on Cinemaquette Statues.

5.title: How Your Countdown Money Could Have Been Better Spent
5.plot: The panel discusses how your Countdown money could have been better spent. Plus, event coverage of Free Comic Book Day (part 1) featuring Estela Maldonado.

6.title: Summer of Movies 2008, New Star Trek Movie
6.plot: The panel discusses the summer of movies 2008 and new Star Trek movie. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Bob McLeod, event coverage of Free Comic Book Day (part 2) and the FF Mailbag.

7.title: Unionization of Comic Talent
7.plot: The panel discusses the unionization of comic talent. Plus FF Mailbag, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Jim Shooter, a Gone But Not Forgotten segment on Atlas Comics, and event coverage of Free Comic Book Day (part 3).

8.title: New Comics Formats, Movie and Television Remakes
8.plot: The panel discusses new comics formats, movie and television remakes. Plus, event coverage of the Small Press Expo (SPX) and Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Neal Adams.

9.title: The Super Power of Love
9.plot: The panel discusses the super power of love. Plus, a BPD Newsbrief with Andrea McPherson and Ulysses E. Campbell, Devon Sanders interviews Mike Carey, and the FF Mailbag.

10.title: Politics and Political Portrayals in American Comics
10.plot: The panel discusses politics and political portrayals in American comics. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Erik Larsen, a Cool Toys segment on Marvel Legends Avengers action figures, and the FF Mailbag.

11.title: Fantastic Forum Casting Call
11.plot: It's the Fantastic Forum Casting Call. Plus, Ulie Rants on Comic Book Death, New Talent - Julian Lytle, the FF Mailbag, and a Cool Toys segment on Iron Man Movie Armor.

12.title: African-American Portrayals in American Comics
12.plot: The panel discusses African-American portrayals in American comics. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Kyle Baker and covers the Ninth Annual East Coast Black Age of Comics Convention.

13.title: Gay, Lesbian and Transgender Characters and Their Portrayals in American Comics
13.plot: The panel discusses gay, lesbian and transgender characters and their portrayals in American comics. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell takes you through event coverage of Gaylaxicon and the FF Mailbag.

1.title: A Visit to Geppi's Entertainment Museum
1.plot: "Fantastic Forum" takes you inside Geppi's Entertainment Museum in downtown Baltimore, Maryland. Host Devon Sanders tours this amazing pop-culture mecca with Gina Geppi.

2.title: Women's Portrayals and Women Working in American Comics
2.plot: The panel discusses women's portrayals and women working in American comics. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Jo Chen and a feature on Geppi's Entertainment Museum.

3.title: The Advent of Digital Comics - Will Paper Comics Become a Thing of the Past?
3.plot: The panel discusses the advent of digital comics - will paper comics become a thing of the past? Plus, Devon Sanders interviews Howard Chaykin, and a Gone But Not Forgotten feature on The Adventures of Superman.

4.title: Comic Character Profile - Batman
4.plot: The panel offers a comic character profile on Batman. Plus, a Cool Toys segment on Fiberglass Freaks licensed 1966 Batmobile replica and Ulysses E. Campbell interviews David Finch.

5.title: What's the Deal with Vampire/Zombie Worship?
5.plot: What's the deal with vampire/zombie worship? The panel tries to find out. Plus, Billie Rae Bates interviews Charlie Adlard of The Walking Dead comic, and the FF Mailbag.

6.title: Superhero Rogues Galleries
6.plot: The panel discusses superhero rogues galleries. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Jim Starlin, and a Gone But Not Forgotten feature.

7.title: Smartest Comic Book Characters
7.plot: The panel discusses smartest comic book characters. Plus, Sherin Nicole's coverage of Free Comic Book Day 2011 and Ulysses E. Campbell with the FF Mailbag.

8.title: A Visit to Fiberglass Freaks
8.plot: Ulysses Campbell hosts this visit inside Fiberglass Freaks, the official makers of the licensed Batmobile, with special guest Mark Racop.

9.title: Most Unusual Superpowers
9.plot: The panel discusses the most unusual superpowers. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews J.G. Jones, and offers a Gone But Not Forgotten segment on "The Six Million Dollar Man," and the Top Ten Selling Comics of November 2011.

10.title: DC's New 52
10.plot: The panel discusses DC Comics' New 52 series. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Jason Aaron and offers a "Ulie Rants" segment on the Top 10 Hottest Women of Star Trek: The Original Series.

11.title: The Enduring Nature of Doctor Who
11.plot: The panel discusses the enduring nature of Doctor Who. Plus, a Cool Toys segment on Doctor Who Sonic Screwdrivers and an interview with Doctor Who cosplayers.

12.title: The Golden Age of Geeks
12.plot: The panel discusses the "Golden Age of Geeks." Plus, Billie Rae Bates covers Free Comic Book Day 2012 in Baltimore, and a feature on R.U.X. (Rockwell's Universal SeXbots).

13.title: Animated Cartoons Based on Comic Book Properties
13.plot: The panel discusses animated cartoons based on comic book properties. Plus, Devon Sanders interviews Kurt Busiek and a Ulie Rants segment on a "Star Trek" apartment.

1.title: 2012 Summer Movie Round-Up
1.plot: The panel discusses the 2012 Summer Movie Round-Up. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Ivan Reis and a Cool Toys segment on Captain Action.

2.title: Comics Companies' Marketing Gimmicks
2.plot: The panel discusses the various marketing gimmicks used by comics companies. Plus, a Cool Toys segment on the Legend of Gokin Series Tetsujin 28 and a Gone But Not Forgotten feature - In Memoriam 2012.

3.title: 2012 Baltimore Comic Con
3.plot: Billie Rae Bates hosts team coverage of the 2012 Baltimore Comic Con, with interviews also by Ulysses Campbell and Patrick Michael Strange. Features David W. Mack, Eric Powell, Jerry Gaylord, Fred Pierce, and voice actor Phil LaMarr.

4.title: Death in Comic Books/Panelist Current Reads
4.plot: The panelists discuss the death of characters in comic books as well as what titles they're currently reading. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Tim Seeley. Panel shot at Victory Comics in Falls Church, Virginia.

5.title: The Future of Comic Books
5.plot: The panel discusses the future of comic books. Plus, Billie Rae Bates interviews Steve Geppi of Diamond Distributors at Geppi's Entertainment Museum in downtown Baltimore.

6.title: Science Fiction/Fantasy Literature
6.plot: The panel discusses science fiction/fantasy literature. Plus, event coverage of the SFWA 47th Annual Nebula Awards.

7.title: The Fan Convention Experience
7.plot: Show producer and creator Ulysses E. Campbell hosts this special episode all about the fan convention experience. Guests: Marc Nathan, Shelton Drum, Lance Fensterman, Sharvonique Renee Fortune, Karon Flage, Carl Cipra, Nikki Stern.

8.title: The Star Trek Phenomena
8.plot: The panel discusses the phenomena around "Star Trek." Plus, a Cool Toys segment on the MR Studio Scale USS Enterprise.

9.title: Comic Character Profile - Superman
9.plot: The panel discusses the comic character profile of Superman. Shot at Victory Comics in Falls Church, Virginia. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Mark Waid and a Cool Toys segment on the DC Direct Superman vs. Muhammad Ali statue.

10.title: The Relevance and Use of Comics Continuity
10.plot: The panel discusses the relevance and use of comics continuity. Shot at Victory Comics in Falls Church, Virginia. Plus, Billie Rae Bates interviews Walt Simonson and a Cool Toys segment on Bowen Designs Classic Black Panther statue.

11.title: Doctor Who 50th Anniversary
11.plot: The panel discusses the Doctor Who 50th Anniversary. Plus, Ulysses E. Campbell interviews Neil Gaiman and a Cool Toys segment on the Doctor Who TARDIS Photobooth.

12.title: Reimagining Character Gender/Ethnicity, Wonder Woman Movie, Disney/Marvel vs. Warner/DC Movie Approach
12.plot: The panel discusses "Reimagining Character Gender/Ethnicity, Wonder Woman Movie, Disney/Marvel vs. Warner/DC Movie Approach." Plus, Patrick Michael Strange interviews Arthur Suydam and Gone But Not Forgotten: In Memoriam 2013.

13.title: The Return of Valiant Comics
13.plot: Fantastic Forum visits the NYC offices of Valiant Entertainment, the comics company that thrilled fans in the '90s with the likes of X-O Manowar, Harbinger, Turok and Solarr.

1.title: Misogyny in Comics; Women's Perspectives
1.plot: Host Billie Rae Bates and panelists Bria LaVorgna, El Anderson and Abigail Prtichard discuss MISOGYNY IN COMICS on location from Awesome Con DC. Devon Sanders interviews GAIL SIMONE. Cool Toys on DJI's Phantom 2 unmanned aerial vehicle.

2.title: Cosplay 101
2.plot: A panel of cosplayers talk basics of the popular activity in COSPLAY 101 on location from Awesome Con DC. Among the topics discussed are reasons fans engage in cosplay, how costumes and props are made/commissioned and issues surrounding acceptability of race/gender swapping presentations. Featuring Scenes From Awesome Con DC.

3.title: Movie Adaptations of Comic Books
3.plot: Host Billie Rae Bates and panelists discuss the best and worst movie adaptations of comic books on location from Awesome Con DC. Featuring Cool Toys with Joe Fiduccia's K.I.T.T. reproduction from the classic Knight Rider TV series.

4.title: Television Adaptations of Comic Books
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: CAM, Comixology at SPX, George R.R. Martin
5.plot: Daphne O'Neal visits The Cartoon Art Museum, Ulysses E. Campbell talks with Comixology founder John D. Roberts and Marketing VP Chip Mosher at SPX and Abigail Pritchard interviews author George R.R. Martin at Capclave.

6.title: MOSF at Awesome Con, Fiona Staples, Toy Fair, Griff
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

locations: Victory Comics, Falls Church, Virginia, USA
Arlington Independent Media, Arlington, Virginia, USA
imdb.plot outline: FANTASTIC FORUM is a talk/variety program on comics, science fiction, fantasy, horror and their related multimedia. The program is segmented with a panel discussion, interviews, event coverage, parodies, toy/game profiles and a variety of features. The core demographic for the program is males between the ages of 18-35. Objectives of the program are: To establish an influential forum for discussion of the comics industry, to interest youth in the comics industry, science fiction and fantasy literature, to expand interest in and audiences for comics, science fiction and fantasy genres and to promote genre related media.
imdb.title: Fantastic Forum
plot: FANTASTIC FORUM is a talk/variety program on comics, science fiction, fantasy, horror and their related multimedia. The program is segmented with a panel discussion, interviews, event coverage, parodies, toy/game profiles and a variety of features. The core demographic for the program is males between the ages of 18-35. Objectives of the program are: To establish an influential forum for discussion of the comics industry, to interest youth in the comics industry, science fiction and fantasy literature, to expand interest in and audiences for comics, science fiction and fantasy genres and to promote genre related media.::_Fantastic Forum_ (qv)
